meanings.definition: To change the order or arrangement of a set of things
meanings.sent1: She enjoys permuting her room furniture to create a new look.
meanings.sent2: The students are permuting their seating arrangement for group work.
meanings.sent3: Permuting the toppings on his pizza made it look like a colorful puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The garden gnome seemed to be permuting the flowers into a harmonious dance.
meanings.sent5: Permuting the ingredients in a recipe can lead to surprising flavors.

meanings.definition: To rearrange in all possible ways
meanings.sent1: The computer program is permuting the numbers to find the optimal sequence.
meanings.sent2: By permuting the colors, she created a beautiful mosaic pattern.
meanings.sent3: He was permuting the words in his poem to see if it changed the meaning.
meanings.sent4: The artist was permuting the shapes in her painting to evoke different emotions.
meanings.sent5: Permuting the outfits in her closet helped her discover new fashion combinations.
